cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.DM, cs.IT, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the extension of the notion of belief functions, which is a fundamental concept in artificial intelligence and machine learning. Therefore, cs.AI is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves the use of mathematical structures such as lattices, which are commonly used in machine learning and data mining, making cs.LG another likely sub-category. The paper also deals with the construction and manipulation of belief functions, which falls under the scope of cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics). The paper also involves the use of information theory concepts such as commonality function and possibility distributions, making cs.IT a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with the generalization of a well-known result in the theory of belief functions, making cs.SI (Systems and Control) a possible sub-category.
